http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: The LiPD Ontology aims to provide a common vocabulary for annotating paleoclimatology data

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The LiPD Ontology aims to provide a common vocabulary for annotating paleoclimatology data

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Make the model behind the calibration explicit

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Metadata about how the variable was calibrated to reflect an environmental variable

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The data, metadata, and Model that describe the set of Variables used to relate depth/position to time (chronological information)

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: DataTable containing Variables pertaining to chronological information

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Model used to derive a time (or age) axis from the ChronDataModel

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value:
Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components.

Agreed that the ProxySystem concept applies to both Chron and PaleoData

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The combination of ProxyArchive, ProxySensor, and ProxyObservations pertaining to chronological information. For instance, measurements of radiocarbon on foraminiferal shells would have a ChronProxySystem consisting of ProxyArchive: marine sediment, ProxySensor: Foraminifera, ProxyObservations: Radiocarbon. (ref: Evans et al. [2013])

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Encodes what Data/Metadata gathering effort/scientific project led to the curation of the Datasets. Examples: PAGES2k, Iso2k, LR04, OC3, MARGO

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A curated aggregation of datasets

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Needed to describe the paleoenvironmental and/or chronological data comprising the dataset as opposed to the Publication, Funding and Location information

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An aggregation of DataTables and Models with their supporting paleoenvironmental and/or chronological information

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Connects to the csv file where the data values are stored

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A set of Variables organized in columns

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Fundamental unit at which we think about paleoclimate data. Also tends to correspond to the scope of the study

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A structured collection of related information, including -but not limited to -measured and/or modelled geograhical, chronological, and environmental data

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Added to allow outputs from Bayesian model (especially Bchron) to be saved as part of a dataset. Required to encode irregular probability distributions

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: DataTable containing the probability distribution of a single value of a Variable. Output of a Model

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Added to allow outputs from Bayesian model to be saved as part of a dataset

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: DataTable constaining many possible series of how the Variable is modeled. Output of a Model

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to associate a grant number following U.S. federal regulation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Source of monetary support underlying the collection/creation/analysis/curation of the Dataset

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: See InferredVariable Ontology for concept description.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A Variable that is inferred from one or more MeasuredVariable (s)

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Encode the Genus and Species metadata

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An inorganic substrate sensing enviromental changes. Examples: karst, snow, watershed, ice sheet, rock, etc.

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Needed to categorize types of instruments used for taking the different measurements. See Instrument Ontology for concept description.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A tool  used to produce MeasuredVariables

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Soilwater mixing above speleothems: Although the sample might only represent 5 years of calcification, it can record 30 years of water mixing.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The time it takes for the ProxySensor to imprint environmental information on the ProxyArchive. It may be further qualified with time periods and units

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Used to describe the interpretation of the Variable. For instance, radiocarbon is interpreted to represent age

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A suite of metadata that describes which phenomena drove variability in this Variable (e.g. environmental drivers).

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Gives information about where the ProxyArchive comes from.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The geographic data and metadata for the dataset

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subclass of Variables. Allows to make the disctinction between raw measurements (e.g., tree ring width, oxygen isotopes, trace elements) and the variables being reconstructed (e.g., moisture, temperature)

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Variables that are measured by an Instrument. MeasuredVariables are ssn: Observations. They represent the values of a certain type of ProxyObservations

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subclass of DataTable. Allows InferredVariables (despite the name) for practical purposes

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: DataTable that contains the Variables (both measured and inferred)

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to describe models whose outputs are stored in the Dataset. One example of is Bchron for age modeling

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A mathematical construct that is at least partially isomorphic to the target system, and is used to derive information about the structure and/or dynamics of the target system

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subclass of Publication.Allows to clearly mark datasets not generated as part of a peer-reviewed publication.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A publication that has not undergone a formal review process; for instance, a Dataset attached to a dissertation.

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subclass of ProxySensor. Makes the distinction between organic and inorganic. See the ProxySensor ontology for concepts

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Biologically-mediated ProxySensor. Examples include: foraminifera, trees, mollusks, polyps

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The Data pertaining to past environmental variability

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: DataTable containing PaleoData Variables

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Model used to derive an environmental axis from the PaleoDataModel

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value:
Gives a formal definition of climate proxy following the Evans et al. (2013) framework.
Subclass of ProxySystem, pertaining to climate information

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Climate observations prior to the instrumental era are necessarily indirect. These observations are made on climate proxies in various geological (e.g. lake or marine sediments, living or fossil coral reefs, cave deposits), glaciological (ice cores or snow pits) or biological (trees) archives. Many types of measurements can be made on each archives, each sensing a different aspect of the environment (sometimes, several aspects at once). A paleoclimate dataset is a set of observations made on an archive.

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subclass of Publication.Allows to clearly mark datasets generated as part of a peer-reviewed publication.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A Publication that has undergone a formal peer-review process

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: The researcher, author on a publication.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An individual who has participated directly or indirectly in the authoring of any resources on the LinkedEarth wiki

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Used to differentiate between the concept of a ProxyArchive and its physical (real) manifestation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The actual sample on which the measurements are made. For instance, the lake core analyzed in the lab is the physical sample.

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value:
"See ProxyArchive ontology for details about the concept.

We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community"

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: According to the Evans et al. (2013), the medium in which the response of a ProxySensor to environmental forcing is recorded. Example of archives include: marine sediments, corals, wood, lake sediments, speleothems, glacier ice

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community"

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A Model of how the ProxySensor either creates or emplaces the signal into the ProxyArchive. Sensu Evans et al. (2013)

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value:
See ProxyObservation ontology for details about the concept.

We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The type of MeasuredVariables measured on the ProxyArchive, whether chemical (e.g. Mg/Ca, D18O, Sr/Ca), physical (e.g. density, layer thickness), or biological (e.g. Species abundance)

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The Model of how ProxyObservations are made on the archive. Sensu Evans et al. (2013)

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value:
See ProxySensor ontology for details about the concept.

We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The sensor comprises physical, chemical, and/or biological components that react to environmental conditions. Sensors often respond to more than one environmental variable, and may have complex responses to the environment they sense, including thresholds (record only part of the range of environmental conditions), seasonal biases (record environmental conditions over a few months of the year), and/or nonlinear responses (Evans et al. (2013)). Signals recorded by the ProxySensor are imprinted onto the ProxyArchive.

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: One component of the ProxySystemModel

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A Model of the ProxySensor. Sensu Evans et al. (2013)

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as "proxy" in the paleoclimate community

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
Climate observations prior to the instrumental era are necessarily indirect. These observations are made on climate proxies in various geological (e.g. lake or marine sediments, living or fossil coral reefs, cave deposits), glaciological (ice cores or snow pits) or biological (trees) archives. Many types of data can often be collected from each archives, each sensing a different aspect of the environment (sometimes, several aspects at once). A paleoclimate dataset is almost always a time series of observations made on an archive.

Evans et al. (2013) [1] define a proxy system as comprised of three components (Fig 1).:

  • The sensor comprises physical, chemical, and/or biological components that react to environmental conditions. Sensors often respond to more than one environmental variable, and may have complex responses to the environment they sense, including thresholds (record only part of the range of environmental conditions), seasonal biases (record environmental conditions over a few months of the year), and/or nonlinear responses. For instance, foraminifera are an often used sensor for oceanic conditions. Multiple observations can be made on this sensor, recording different environmental variables. Similarly, picking foraminifera of a given species to conduct the measurements is part of the observation process, though it does affect the sensor definition : the habitat of these forams determines with environmental variable (e.g. surface, sub-surface, or thermocline temperature) they are most sensitive to.
  • The archive is the medium in which the response of a sensor to environmental forcing is recorded. Marine sediments are a type of archive, on which many sensors and observations may be recorded (e.g. Foraminifera Mg/Ca, δ18O, TEX86)
  • Observations are made on archives and are generally referred to as "proxies". The term "proxy" used ubiquitously, and often ambiguously, throughout the paleoclimate literature, is most commonly equivalent to "sensor + observation". "Observation" is the more explicit, and thus, preferred term, however "proxy" can be treated as a synonym of "observation". For instance, Foraminifera Mg/Ca is often used to investigate past changes in sea-surface temperature but depends also on sea-surface salinity and deep-ocean carbonate saturation [2]. Furthermore, its temperature and salinity dependence is exponential [3] [4] [5] while its response to carbonate saturation is thresholded [6].

These three major components may be individually modeled, and linked together within a Proxy System Model [1] [7]. Some sensors are common to multiple archives (e.g. δ18O), and all archives support more than one possible sensor.

References

  1. ↑ Jump up to: 1.0 1.1 1.2 Evans, M. N., Tolwinski-Ward, S. E., Thompson, D. M., & Anchukaitis, K. J. (2013). Applications of proxy system modeling in high resolution paleoclimatology. Quaternary Science Reviews, 76, 16-28. doi:10.1016/j.quascirev.2013.05.024
  2. Jump up ↑ Khider, D., Huerta, G., Jackson, C., Stott, L. D., & Emile-Geay, J. (2015). A Bayesian, multivariate calibration for Globigerinoides ruber Mg/Ca. Geochemistry Geophysics Geosystems, 16(9), 2916-2932. doi:10.1002/2015GC005844
  3. Jump up ↑ Anand, P., Elderfield, H., & Conte, M. H. (2003). Calibration of Mg/Ca thermometry in planktonic foraminifera from a sediment trap time series. Paleoceanography, 18(2), 1050. doi:10.1029/2002PA000846
  4. Jump up ↑ Lea, D. W., Mashiotta, T. A., & Spero, H. J. (1999). Controls on magnesium and strontium uptake in planktonic foraminifera determined by live culturing. Geochimica et cosmochimica acta, 63(16), 2369-2379.
  5. Jump up ↑ Kisakürek, B., Eisenhauer, A., Böhm, F., Garbe-Schönberg, D., & Erez, J. (2008). Controls on shell Mg/Ca and Sr/Ca in cultured planktonic foraminiferan, Globigeriniodes ruber (white). Earth and Planetary Science Letters, 273, 260-269. doi:10.1016/j.epsl.2008.06.026
  6. Jump up ↑ Regenberg, M., Regenberg, A., Garbe-Schonberg, D., & Lea, D. W. (2014). Global dissolution effects on planktonic foraminiferal Mg/Ca ratios controlled by the calcite-saturation state of bottom waters. Paleoceanography, 29, 127-142. doi:10.1002/2013PA002492
  7. Jump up ↑ Dee, S., Emile-Geay, J., Evans, M. N., Allam, A., Steig, E. J., & Thompson, D. M. (2015). PRYSM: An open-source framework for PRoxy System Modeling, with applications to oxygen-isotope systems. Journal of Advances in Modeling Earth Systems, 7, 1220-1247. doi:10.1002/2015MS000447

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as "proxy" in the paleoclimate community

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: In the Evans et al. (2013) framework, this is the combination of sensor, archive and observation models . "A generalized proxy system model encapuslates a simplified representation of prior physical, chemical, biological, and/or geological understanding of the ways in which environmental variation ultimately results in the observations used to retrieve paleoclimatic information."

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Can be used to credit the contributor of the dataset as well as linking toward the conclusions of the study and relevant methods

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A document that serves as reference for a Dataset or its components

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Class added to describe the annual resolution of the archives

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Refers to the time difference between two adjacent values of a Variable.

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Added to allow for a link towards the code if on a public repository like GitHub

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A script that describes the model, in any programming language (e.g., Excel, Matlab, Python, R)

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to represent a summary of basic statistics such as median, mean, standard deviation, and various quantiles from the output of the Model

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A DataTable that contains summary information for the Variable and is output from a Model.

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: To allow to describe the uncertainty on a Variable or a Model, would it be a single number (e.g., the uncertainty on the measurements are 0.1 per mil, one sigma confidence level, or reportedIn an EnsembleTable and/or SummaryTable)

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A state of incomplete knowledge that results from a lack of information or from different modeling choices. Uncertainty may come from many sources, from imprecision in the data to ambigously defined concepts or terminology. Uncertainty can be represented by quantitative measures (e.g., probability density function) or by qualitative statements (e.g., reflecting the judgement of a team of experts). Sensu IPCC AR5

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows description of how uncertainty was calculated

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A Model quantifiying the Uncertainty

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Basic definition of the values in the columns of the csv file

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Quantities that may change from value to value. They are usually represented as column of values in a data table

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Give credit to the original author of the resource

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Who wrote (i.e., created) the resource, such as a Publication?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Separate between journal and book publication

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which book was the resource published?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Provides calibration information, especially useful for legacy datasets where the raw measurements may not be available and for comparison of datasets.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What calibration process was used to relate the InferredVariable to the MeasuredVariable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Relationship needed to link to a Publication desribing the calibration being applied to the dataset

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In what Reference(s) is the Calibration described/justified?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subproperty of modeledBy. The subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the ChronModel for the ChronData or ProxySystem under consideration?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Describe the geographical coordinates for the provenance of the ProxyArchive where the dataset was collected from

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Where (in the world) was the data in the Dataset collected? Refers to the location of the ProxyArchive

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Data property needed to specify how to cite compilations, in order to provide appropriate credit to all contributors

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: How should someone cite the compilation?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Separate compilation date from the publication year. An example is LR04 (datsetdate in 2004) but published in 2005

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: At what date was the Compilation created?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Needed to state the version associated to a compilation, which may not be the same as the datasets it contains

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the version of the Compilation?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows distinction between contributor to a resource and the author

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Who contributed the resource? A contributor may be the same as the authors of the resource or different. For instance, in the case of a legacy dataset, a Linked Earth member may contribute a previously-published dataset that he/she may not have authored

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: The need for providing appropriate credit to the datasets

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Sentence indicating how a dataset should be cited

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Separate dataset date from the publication year. An example is LR04 (datsetdate in 2004) but published in 2005

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: At what date was the Dataset created?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Property needed to let other scientists know about the usage and attribution terms of the uploaded dataset

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: License associated to a dataset

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to update a dataset if Data/Models are added and keep track of the various versions

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
Answers the question: What is the version of the Dataset?

It should follow the x.y.z notation where x refers to changes in metadata and data following a publication (for instance, the creation of a new age model using a different code), y refers to changes to the data following a publication (for instance, adding data further back in time without changing the model underlying the interpretation), and z refers to changes not associated with a publication (for instance, typos).

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: This property may be used to provide further details on instrument descriptions, uncertainty description,etc.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What additional details would you give about the resource?
Answers the  "of what" question for an Interpretation. For intance, sea surface in sea surface temperature.

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: "Subproperty of foundinTable to Link the Model to its outputs"

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which DistributionTable is the Model output found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allow to store contact information

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the email address of the Person?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: "Subproperty of foundinTable to link the Model to its outputs"

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which EnsembleTable is the Model output found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to provide the equation as part of the metadata

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the mathematical formulation of the Model?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subproperty of foundinTable to link the Data to the Variables

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which MeasurementTable are the Variables found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to link the data to the csv table and the models to its output

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which DataTable can the information/data be found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links a dataset to its source of funding

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What was the Funding source for the Dataset?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Provides information about the Agency funding the study

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which entity was the Dataset fundedBy?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Provides information about the country the agency is from

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which nation funded the Dataset?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Needed to link the model to the data tables it generates

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: which model was used to generated this data table?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Provides information about the grant number

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the unique identifier associated with the Funding for the Dataset?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links a Model to its SoftwareCode.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What SoftwareCode was used to generate the Model output?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the Variable metadata to the values stored in the csv file

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which column of the csv file can the Variable be found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to link to a resource using a digital object identifier

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the digital object identifier associated with the resource?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows assigning external ids to datasets

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Associates a dataset with an external identifier

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to store the execution command of a script

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the command to run the script or the code?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Provides information about the operating system version in which the software code was exceuted?

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which environment is the script meant to be run in?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links a DataTable with its appropriate csv file

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the name of the csv file in which the Variable values are stored?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Needed to properly described physical samples

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: IGSN identifier associated to a physical sample

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Link to the ISBN: Identifier used commonly to refer to publications

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the international book number of the Publication?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: 8-digit code used to identify publications

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the International Standard Serial Number of the Publication?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Property added to link the proxySystem to the IntegrationTime class

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the integration time needed for a ProxySensor to imprint environmental information on the ProxyArchive? Both are included as part of a ProxySystem

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to point to the original source of a resource

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the universal resource locator to a resource?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: property relevant to facilitate queries, as in most cases the contents of a csv file are not directly represented

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the maximum value of the Variable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: property relevant to facilitate queries, as in most cases the contents of a csv file are not directly represented

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the mean value of the Variable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: property relevant to facilitate queries, as in most cases the contents of a csv file are not directly represented

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the median value of the Variable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: property relevant to facilitate queries, as in most cases the contents of a csv file are not directly represented

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the minimum value of the Variable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Useful for coding around the missing values

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: How are the missing values of the Variable identified in the DataTable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the MeasuredVariable to its ProxySystem. For instance, Mg/Ca measurements on foraminiferal shells have ProxySystem: MarineSediment.Foraminifera.Mg/Ca

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the ProxySystem associated with this MeasuredVariable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to rank the environmental variable controlling the interpretation. For instance, the d18O of coral aragonite responds to both temperature and the d18O of seawater (closely linked to salinity). Depending on the locale and/or timescale, one variable may dominate over the other.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the importance of the Interpretation?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Needed to link a Variable to Resolution

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the Resolution of the Variable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links to the Uncertainty class

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the Uncertainty associated with the Variable, Model, or Instrument?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the units and the values of the Variable

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In what unit of measure is (are) the Variable(s) expressed?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Useful if there is only a single value rather than a vector of numbers. Often the case for analytical uncertainty or uncertainty reported as a RMSE

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What are the numerical values of the Variable, Uncertainty, and Model outputs?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value:
LiPD assigns a unique identifier (TSid) to each table column described in a LiPD file.

Allows to assign a unique identifier to each series, facilitating data citation and recognition

This allows someone to change every piece of metadata about column or dataset, including its names (both dataset and variable) and still get back to the right spot. It’s fundamental to working with LiPD data.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the unique identifier for the Variable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Link to a particular laboratory. Provides circumstantial information about the measurement technique and how it was applied. Allows to give some information about the actual location of the sample

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which laboratory/repository is the Instrument/PhysicalSample located?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subproperty of includesData. The subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which ChronData are included in the Dataset?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links Dataset to Data

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which Data are included in the Dataset?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subproperty of includesData. The subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which PaleoData are included in the Dataset?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links DataTable to Variable

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which Variables are included in the DataTable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Provides a link between the Measured and Inferred Variables. For instance, SST is inferred from Mg/Ca measurements

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: From which MeasuredVariable(s) is (are) the InferredVariable inferred from?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the InferredVariable values to their type. For instance, the value of 29.1 degC is of type SST. This is important to normalize the variations in VariableNames (e.g. SST, sst, sea-surface temp)

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What type of InferredVariable does the InferredVariable belongs to?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value:
Answer is only positive or negative. Useful metadata when the calibration equation is not readily available.
Also applies to InferredVariable to faciliate the search in database

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Is the InferredVariable value increasing or decreasing as the value of the MeasuredVariable is increasing?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links an interpretation to a reference citation (can be the same as the calibrationReferences for a Dataset)

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which Publication(s) is the Interpretation substantiated?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the Variable to its Interpretation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the Variable's Interpretation?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Added to allow data analysis. Is the interpretation relevant to these coordinates? Does putting a colored dot on the map here make sense?

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Does the Interpretation describe local variability, or far-field variability that may not reflect local conditions?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Part of standard metadata for Publications

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In what issue of the journal can the resource be found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Part of standard metadata for Publications

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the name of the journal in which the resource can be found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the MeasuredVariable to the Instrument responsible for its creation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which Instrument was used to produce the MeasuredVariable?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the MeasuredVariable to the ProxyArchive. Refers to the specific archive (i.e. the specific coral head, lake sediment...) and a specific Variable since ProxyArchive provides a link to the ProxySensor. In some instances, two MeasuredVariables on the same PhysicalSample may have different ProxyArchive page. This would be the case for measurements on various species of foraminifera in a MarineSediment

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: On which PhysicalSample was the MeasuredVariable measured?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to describe methods.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: How is the information obtained from the resource?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value:
Links a Model to its Publication.
Note: calibrationReferences and modelReferences in the Calibration may not need to be the same. For instance, the calibration data and one mathematical formulation can be provided in one Publication (answering the calibrationReferences) but a different mathematical Model may be applied in another Publication (answering the modelReferences)

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which Publication is the model described/applied?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links Data, Compilation or ProxySystem to Model

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the Model for the Data, Compilation or ProxySystem under consideration?
Answers the question: How is the resource called?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to add notes to specific cells in the DataTable

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What additional information would you give about the Variable or DataTable ?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: LinkedEarth uses ORCID number for membership

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the persistent digital identifier of the Person?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Part of standard metadata for Publications

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In what pages of the Publication can the reference to the resource be found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subclass of modeledBy, pertaining to paleoenvironmental information

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the PaleoModel for the PaleoData or ProxySytem under consideration?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the dataset to the compilation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answer the question: Which compilation does a dataset belong to?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the source of Funding to the PI (a Person)

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Who was the lead on the source of Funding for the Dataset?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Provides the user with information about the software

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which language was the software code written in?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links ProxySystemModel to ProxyArchiveModel

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which ProxyArchiveModel is used in the ProxySystemModel?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links ProxySystem to ProxyArchive

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which ProxyArchive underlies this ProxySystem?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links ProxySystemModel to ProxyObservationModel

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which ProxyObservationModel is used in the ProxySystemModel?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: The need to link a measured variable or a proxy system to the proxy observation type being measured.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
Answers the question: What type of ProxyObservation does the MeasuredVariable or Proxy System belong to?
For example, the measured value of 5.63 mmol/mol is of type Mg/Ca, or the proxy observation of the current prpoxy system is Mg/Ca

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links ProxySystemModel to ProxySensorModel

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which ProxySensorModel is used in the ProxySystemModel?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links ProxySensor to ProxyArchive

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which ProxySensor underlies this ProxySystem?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Part of standard metadata for Publications

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What year was the Publication issued?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the resource to its Publication

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which Publication was the Dataset or Compilation issued?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Often it's useful to put a quote from the paper that describes the interpretation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Which part of the publication describes the Calibration or Interpretation?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Links the uncertainty to the model output

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which EnsembleTable, DistributionTable, and/or SummaryTable is the Uncertainty reported?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to separate the various types of interpretation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: how would you classify the Interpretation? Examples include Isotope, Climate…

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Seasonality is critical to properly related measuredVariable and innferredVariable, as the former only senses part of the range of the latter.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: To which part of the year is the Interpretation or ProxySensor restricted to? Acceptable answers may be "MJJA", "growing season",or [5,6,7,8]

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Scientific Name of the organic ProxySensor

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the Genus of the Organic ProxySensor?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Scientific Name of the organic ProxySensor

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the species of the Organic ProxySensor?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Crucial for isotopic measurements (for instance, d18O measurements (VSMOW vs VPDB))

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: Reference material against which the MeasuredVariable is reported?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Subproperty of foundinTable to link the Model to its outputs

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which SummaryTable can the statistics on the Model Output be found?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Provides depth information. Can link to the depth Variable in the DataTable

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: At which depth in the ProxyArchive is the Variable measured or inferred?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Part of standard metadata for Publications

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: What is the title of the Publication?

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Allows to properly make use of the reported Uncertainty values

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
Answers the question: What parameter of the error distribution is the Uncertainty value referring to?

Examples include 1-sigma, 2-sigma, 95% confidence bounds

http://www.linkedmodel.org/schema/vaem#r.@value: Part of standard metadata for Publications

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Answers the question: In which volume of the Publication does the reference to the Datatset appear?

The class ssn:Observation provides the structure to represent a single observation. An observation is a situation that describes an observed feature, an observed property, a sensor and method of sensing used and a value observed for the property: that is, an observation describes a single value attributed to a single property by a particular sensor. Observations of multiple features or multiple properties of the one feature should be represented as either compound properties, features and values or as multiple observations, grouped in some appropriate structure.
